intro: Dimetia obliquinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined dimetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, slightly serrated margin. Dimetia obliquinervis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
